name: deafly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving in a way that shows that you are unwilling to listen: He deafly subscribes to these beliefs, and is not open to any new ideas. Sadly, British and other world leaders have been deafly ignoring the deteriorating situation.
in a way that shows that you are unable to hear, either completely or partly: He proposed a new law that banned drivers from wearing headphones, because motorists were deafly ignoring emergency vehicles. The baby slept deafly through the whole thing.
More examplesFewer examplesHe encouraged music lovers to choose not to blindly - or rather deafly - consume whatever music was on offer.The place was deafly silent, the only sound being her breathing.Why have they isolated themselves blindly and deafly from current events?
